level.text: 1299.1 When used in this chapter, the following words and phrases shall havehe meaning ascribed.
Associates – is a voluntary relationship of employment, contract, ownership,r other legal affiliation. An association not in writing shall be ineffectiveor purposes of this title.

Livery tags – vehicle tags issued by a motor vehicle licensing agency for aublic vehicle-for-hire used to provide luxury class services, including theL” tags issued by DMV.
Luxury class service or LCS service – limousine and sedan service.
Luxury class vehicle or LCS vehicle – a public vehicle-for-hire that:
Is a “Luxury Sedan”, an “Upscale Sedan”, or a “Sport Utilityehicle” (“SUV”), as defined by the EPA (available at:
http://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/powerSearch.jsp), or the Chrysler 300, provided,owever, that if it is an SUV, it has a passenger volume of at least one hundredwenty (120) cubic feet;
Does not have a manufacturer’s rated seating capacity of ten (10) or moreersons, and;
Is not a salvaged vehicle or a vehicle rented from an entity whoseredominant business is that of renting motor vehicles on a time basis.
Operator – an individual who operates an LCS vehicle.

Owner – a person, corporation, partnership, or association, including an LCSrganization or independent owner, that holds the legal title to an LCS vehicle,he registration of which is required in the District of Columbia. If a vehicles the subject of an agreement for the conditional sale or lease with the rightf purchase upon performance of the condition stated in the agreement and withn immediate right of possession vested in the conditional vendee or lessee, orf a mortgagor of a vehicle is entitled to possession, then the conditionalendee, lessee, or mortgagor shall be considered the owner.
Sedan – a public vehicle-for-hire that:
Meets the requirements for a luxury class vehicle;
Is not stretched;

Is any “dark” color other than 15-1150 TCX, 15-1150 TPX, 16-035 TCX, or6-035 TPX, or any “black” color, as defined by Pantone LLC (available at:ttp://www.pantone.com/pages/pantone/colorfinder.aspx); and
Has a passenger volume of at least ninety five (95) cubic feet, according to thePA (available at:
http://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/powerSearch.jsp).
Washington Metropolitan Area – has the same meaning ascribed in § 499.1.
